meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Wuthering Waves: A Game That's Got Some 'Splainin' To Do!

Hey there, fellow gamers! It's your boy Hippo Penny here, and I'm back with another review that's all about dishing out the tea on Kuro Games' latest open-world action RPG, Wuthering Waves. Now, I know what you're thinking - "Hippo, why should I care about another gacha game?" Well, let me tell you, this one's got some legs (get it? like Genshin Impact?), and I'm here to break it down for ya.

First off, the combat in Wuthering Waves is straight fire. It's fast-paced, fun, and has just the right amount of complexity to keep things interesting. And hey, who doesn't love a good ol' fashioned button-mashing session? The exploration aspect is also on point, with plenty of nooks and crannies to discover (or get lost in, depending on your sense of adventure).

But let's talk about those pesky flaws. You know, the ones that make you go "Hmm, maybe I should just stick with Genshin Impact?" Yeah, they're there. The story is... meh. It's got some nice moments, but it's also pretty predictable and doesn't really add much to the overall experience. And don't even get me started on the voice acting - some of these characters sound like they were recorded by a sleepy intern.

Now, I know what you're thinking - "Hippo, why are you being so harsh?" Well, let me tell you, as a critic (or as I like to call myself, a "game-skeptical-guru"), it's my job to give you the lowdown. And while Wuthering Waves has some major strengths, it also needs to work on those weaknesses.

So, what's the verdict? Well, if you're looking for a solid open-world action game with some serious combat chops, Wuthering Waves is definitely worth checking out. Just don't expect me to be singing its praises anytime soon (unless they fix that story, stat).

And hey, speaking of other critics, let's take a look at what the "experts" had to say:

* Movies Games and Tech gave it 70/100, saying it's got some solid long-term potential.
* GamingBolt also scored it 70/100, calling it a "very solid out-of-the-gate" experience.
* But Why Tho? came in at 50/100, citing plenty of problems (ouch, harsh much?!).
* INVEN gave it 85/100, praising its fast-paced action and attractive graphics (yaaas, beauty is important!).
* GLHF on Sports Illustrated scored it 70/100, saying it's trying too hard to be like Genshin Impact.
* And finally, Jeuxvideo.com came in at 75/100, calling it a "convincing" experience for those looking for an alternative (yep, that's me, Hippo Penny!).

So, there you have it - Wuthering Waves: A Game That's Got Some 'Splainin' To Do! Will it win over your heart? Maybe. Will it give you a few hundred hours of solid gaming time? Absolutely!
